src.multiweatherapi.multiweatherapi module¶

class src.multiweatherapi.multiweatherapi.ApiWrapper(params: dict)¶

Bases: object

This class is a wrapper for all the various vendor API classes that make up MWAPI.

check_params()¶

This module checks to see if the vendor is specified in the parmeter dictionary and is in the list of approved vendors.

Raises:

Exception – If the vendor is non-existent or is not in the list of approved vendors.

get_reading()¶

This module will do the following: 1) Create the parameter object that matches the vendor. 2) Checks to make sure that no entry in the parameter dictionary is the empty string. 3) Checks to make sure that all required parameters are present and are of the correct type and properly

formats any dates.

  1. Create the readings object for the vendor.

  2. Gets the readings from the vendor API.

  3. Gets the resp_raw object (which holds the data as it was received from the API) and converts it into a dictionary.

  4. Gets the resp_transformed object (which hold the data after it has been transformed into a DB compatible format).

If there is an exception raised by the vendor parameter or readings classes, then this method will create an error message which will be placed in the raw_data table to serve as an easily accessible log.

src.multiweatherapi.multiweatherapi.get_reading(vendor: str, **params) → <module 'json' from 'C:\\Users\\robins80\\AppData\\Local\\Continuum\\anaconda3\\envs\\sphinx\\lib\\json\\__init__.py'>¶

This method will call the vendor API and retrieve the data.

Return type:

The readings from the vendor API.

src.multiweatherapi.multiweatherapi.get_version() → str¶

This module returns the version number of the mwapi package.

Return type:

The package version.

src.multiweatherapi.utilities module¶

class src.multiweatherapi.utilities.Utilities¶

Bases: object

A class of helper utilities to reduce replication of code across the multiweatherapi modules.

case_insensitive_key(this_key)¶

A class to look for keys in a dictionary, disregarding case.

This method is used to look for a particular key in the response string returned by the vendor API call. Some vendors use ‘Message’, and others use ‘message’.

Parameters:

  • this_dict (dict) – The dictionary containing the response from the vendor API.

  • this_key (str) – They key we are looking for in the response.

Returns:

resp_raw – The value associated with this_key.

Return type:

str

check_empty_str()¶

Raises exception if any of the parameters are submitted with empty string.

This method is implemented to prevent unexpected behaviors of weather station API when empty string is passed to one or more parameters. This method iterates all key value pairs in the parameter dictionary and if it encounters any empty string variable, it will raise exception. This method is called in the multiweatherapi.py right after Param object for specific vendor is instantiated. This decision is made to rely on Mike’s error handling routine to catch the exception raised from this method and generate output response properly

Parameters:

input_param (dict) – A dictionary of parameters.

convert_to_dict(davisParm=None)¶

Takes a resp_raw list object and converts it to a straight dictionary.

The resp_raw object starts off as a list, but it needs to be converted to a dictionary before it is written to the raw_data table. If this is a Davis station, we need to go through all the resp_raw items as each item in resp_raw is a new 24-hour slice of data. This is because Davis stations can only return 24 hours worth of data at a time, so it is called multiple times if we are pulling more than a day’s worth of data.

Parameters:

  • resp_raw (list) – The original resp_raw object.

  • davisParm (DavisParam, optional) – If present, these are the parameters used to call the Davis API.

Returns:

new_raw – The resp_raw object as a dictionary, with the information from the API call placed in the ‘api_output’ entry.

Return type:

dict

create_error_response(parms, readings, error_msg)¶

Create an error response that will get placed in the resp_raw field.

This method came about because it was decided that the raw_data table can double as a log of sorts. Therefore, it was necessary to change how mwapi handled exceptions. Instead of throwing an exception, mwapi will call this method to create a list that can be placed in the resp_raw attribute of the vendor class. This is mostly for troubleshooting if there was a problem with either the passed parameters or the API call itself.

Parameters:

  • vendor (str) – The name of the vendor.

  • parms (vendor parameter object) – The parameters that were passed to the vendor API.

  • readings (vendor readings object) – The readings that were returned by the vendor API (if any).

  • error_msg (str) – The error message to place into resp_raw.

Returns:

return_list – A list of items that would have been returned if the API call was successful.

Return type:

list

expected_timestamp(st_time: datetime, ed_time: datetime)¶

Given start and end datetime, provides list of timestamps of measurement readings that are expected

This method is implemented to provide expected data/time stamps of measurement readings for all weather station vendors. This information is used to know missing data points (if there is any) and calculate percentage of correct data rate when we summarize the readings for certain timeframe

Parameters:

  • vendor (str) – Weather station vendor name

  • st_time (datetime) – Start datetime object (UTC)

  • ed_time (datetime) – End datetime object (UTC)

Returns:

datetime_list – Datetime object list that represents expected timestamps given start and end date/time

Return type:

list

init_transformed_resp(st_time, ed_time)¶

Initialize transformed response

This method is used to create initial transformed response using expected timestamp list generated by expected_timestamp() method and fill

Parameters:

  • vendor (str) – Weather station vendor name

  • st_time (datetime) – Start datetime object (UTC)

  • ed_time (datetime) – End datetime object (UTC)

Returns:

measurement_list – Initialized transformed response list with None value for measurement readings

Return type:

list

insert_resp(trasrec_dict: dict)¶

Insert measurement readings for a timestamp to transformed response list

This method uses search_timestamp method to find the index of the specific date/time weather station data dictionary in the transformed response list and then fill in each measurement reading

Parameters:

  • transformed_resp (list) – Transformed response list

  • trasrec_dict (dict) – measurement label and value pairs of a single timestamp

Returns:

transformed_resp – Transformed response list

Return type:

list

local_to_utc(local_timezone, input_datetime_format='%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')¶

Converts local date/time string to UTC datetime object

This method is implemented to convert data/time string in various format and time-zone to a UTC datetime object

Parameters:

  • input_datetime_str (str) – User input date/time string

  • local_timezone (str) – User’s current time zone (‘HT’: ‘US/Hawaii’, ‘AT’: ‘US/Alaska’, ‘PT’: ‘US/Pacific’, ‘MT’: ‘US/Mountain’, ‘CT’: ‘US/Central’, ‘ET’: ‘US/Eastern’)

  • input_datetime_format (str) – User input date/time format codes(https://strftime.org/) default: ‘%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S’

Returns:

utc_datetime – UTC datetime object converted from user’s input date/time string

Return type:

datetime

search_timestamp(input_datetime)¶

Returns index of the specific measurement reading from transformed response that matches input timestamp

Parameters:

  • transf_resp (list) – Transformed response

  • input_datetime (datetime) – date/time of the measurement reading that you are trying to find

Returns:

x – Index of the measurement reading from transformed response that matches input timestamp

Return type:

int

set_date()¶

This method will try to format the date that was sent to it. If the date sent is invalid, return that, so it will go into the error log correctly.

Parameters:

date (str or datetime) – The date to be set.

Returns:

date – The properly formatted date if the date is a proper date, the original value otherwise.

Return type:

str
